questions.text: All of the following pelvic structures support the vagina, except
questions.explanation:
Solution:

The Infundibulopelvic ligament All the options given in the question are somehow related to the vagina, therefore may have a role in supporting the vagina except the infundibulopelvic ligaments. The infundibulopelvic ligament attaches the ovary to the lateral pelvic wall and supports the ovary, but has no connection to the vagina or uterus , therefore does not support either structure. So, by exclusion, our answer is the infundibulopelvic ligament THE VAGINA IS SUPPORTED IN THE LOWER PART BY: Bulbocavernosus muscle Urogenital diaphragm Perineal muscles Levator ani muscles(pelvic diaphragm)

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman, with a known case of endometriosis, is found to have a cystic mass in the ovary on ultrasonography of her pelvis. A biopsy of the mass was taken and it confirms the condition as endometrioma. On further examination, it was decided that cystectomy is not possible and an oophorectomy is performed. During the procedure, the ovarian vessels were ligated and transected. The ovarian artery and vein are found in which of the following ligaments?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Infundibulopelvic ligament Each broad ligament consists of a double-layer drape of the peritoneum . The peritoneum that folds over the fallopian tube is termed the mesosalpinx, that around the round ligament are the mesoteres, and that over the ovarian ligament is the mesovarium. The Peritoneum that extends beneath the fimbriated end of the fallopian tube toward the pelvic wall forms the suspensory ligament or the infundibulopelvic ligament of the ovary. This contains nerves and ovarian vessels. The broad ligaments are two wing-like structures that extend from the lateral uterine margins to the pelvic sidewalls.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A: The round ligament originates somewhat below and anterior to the origin of the fallopian tubes. Each round ligament extends laterally and down into the inguinal canal, through which it passes, to terminate in the upper portion of the ipsilateral labium majus. Sampson artery, a branch of the uterine artery, runs within this ligament. Option B: The cardinal ligament-also called the transverse cervical ligament or Mackenrodt ligament-anchors medially to the uterus and upper vagina . The cardinal ligament is the thick base of the broad ligament. Option C: Uterosacral ligament originates with a posterolateral attachment to the supravaginal portion of the cervix and inserts into the fascia over the sacrum. These ligaments are composed of connective tissue, small bundles of vessels and nerves, and some smooth muscle. Covered by the peritoneum, these ligaments form the lateral boundaries of the pouch of Douglas.

Extraedge:

Ovarian vessels travel through the infundibulopelvic ligament The ovarian artery is a direct branch of the abdominal aorta The right ovarian vein drains into the inferior vena cava The left ovarian vein drains into the left renal vein

questions.text: You are observing an oophorectomy procedure. The Senior resident ligates ovarian vessels during the procedure. Which of the following structures is most at risk of injury when the ovarian vessels are ligated?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ureter When an (ovariectomy) oophorectomy is performed, the ovarian vessels must be ligated. The ovarian vessels lie anterior to the ureter just proximal to the bifurcation of the aorta. The ureter is the structure that is at the most risk when ligating the ovarian vessels.

Highyeild:

The most notable sites of ureteric injury are At the pelvic brim as the infundibulopelvic ligament is being divided (in 30 per cent of cases) The ovarian fossa during resection of ovaries or ovarian remnants (in 19 per cent of cases) Lateral to the cervix during the division of the uterine artery, the uterosacral ligament and the cardinal ligament (in 51 per cent of cases) 1

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. The uterine artery does anastomose with the ovarian vessels via the ascending uterine artery; however, it lies too far distally to be at risk during ligation of the ovarian vessels. Option: Cand D: The internal pudendal artery and pudendal nerve mostly lie in the perineum and are not at risk.

questions.text: The gynaecology team is planning for the excision of a right-sided ovarian mass. Which of the following structures should be ligated in order to avoid excessive bleeding during the surgery?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Suspensory ligament The ovaries are supplied by ovarian vessels that originate from the abdominal aorta. Ovarian vessels cross the pelvic brim and descend in the suspensory ligament(Infundibulopelvic ligament) of the ovary to supply the ovaries, fimbrial end of the uterine (fallopian) tube, and portions of the abdominal/pelvic ureter.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A and D. These ligaments are devoid of major vessels. Option: C. The ovarian ligament contains nerves and lymphatics.

Extraedge:

Ovarian vessels travel through the infundibulopelvic ligament The Ovarian artery is a direct branch of the abdominal aorta The Right ovarian vein drains into the inferior vena cava Left ovarian vein drains into the left renal vein

questions.text: Identify the marked structure:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Cumulus oophorus The cross section is given below. The marked structure is cumulus oophorus.

questions.text: Select the epithelium lining the vagina:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

A The vagina is lined by non-keratinized, stratified, squamous epithelium similar to, and continuous with, that of the ectocervix.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B: Simple columnar epithelium Option C: Cuboidal epithelium Option D : Pseudostratified ciliated columnar epithelium

questions.text: The arteries supplying the vagina are from

options.label: A
options.text: Anterior division of the external iliac artery

options.label: B
options.text: Posterior division of the external iliac artery

options.label: C
options.text: Anterior division of the internal iliac artery

options.label: D
options.text: Posterior division of the internal iliac artery

questions.correct_answer: C. Anterior division of the internal iliac artery
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Anterior division of the internal iliac artery The upper 1/3rd of the vagina is supplied by the vaginal branches of the uterine artery, and vaginal artery (branch of anterior division of internal iliac artery). Lower2/3rd vagina are supplied by the internal pudendal artery, which arises from the anterior division of the internal iliac artery.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A and B: external iliac artery supplies the lower limb Option: D . posterior division of internal iliac artery divides into the iliolumbar, lateral sacral and superior gluteal artery.

questions.text: Identify the Predominant hormone responsible for A, B and C in the image of vaginal cytology, respectively:

options.label: A
options.text: A- No hormone is Predominant B- progesterone Predominant C- Estrogen Predominant

options.label: B
options.text: A- No hormone is Predominant B- estrogen Predominant C- progesterone Predominant

options.label: C
options.text: A- estrogen Predominant B- progesterone Predominant C- no hormone is Predominant

options.label: D
options.text: A- progesterone Predominant B- no hormone is Predominant C- Estrogen Predominant

questions.correct_answer: A. A- No hormone is Predominant B- progesterone Predominant C- Estrogen Predominant
questions.explanation:
Solution:

A- No hormone is Predominant B- progesterone Predominant C- Estrogen Predominant A- parabasal cell- no hormone Predominant B-intermediate cell- progesterone Predominant C- superficial cell-estrogen Predominant The vaginal epithelium has 3 types of cells. Basal/Parabasal cells are abundant when there is no hormonal predominance. (Before puberty, after Menopause). Intermediate cells are seen when there is ­P during pregnancy and 2 nd half of MC. Superficial cells are seen in 1 st half of MC and abundant when ­ E

questions.text: A 46-year-old woman is seen for evaluation of a large swelling in the anterior aspect of her vagina. You are confused if it is a cystocele. To ascertain, you pass a metal catheter tip per urethra which fails to come underneath the vaginal mucosa. You arrive at a diagnosis. What is the corresponding embryological Homologous structure in males?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Epididymis Epididymis is the Homologous structure in males.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A: is the diagnosis, as the catheter tip fails to come under the vaginal mucosa. Option: B. is the embryological origin of G artner's duct Option: D. Is the embryological remnant of paramesonephric ducts in males.

Extraedge:

Proximal remnant of wolffian tubule: epoophoron Distal remnant of wolffian tubule: paraphoron Wolffian duct remnant is gartners duct Gartner's duct cyst

questions.text: A 25-year-old married woman came to OPD with a history of foul-smelling vaginal discharge and itching. A PV examination was done while doing PV an accidental finding as given below was observed on the anterolateral vaginal walls. The consultant told you that the cystic finding is due to obstruction of a remnant structure. What is the anatomical location of the remnant structure that leads to this condition?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Leaves of broad ligament The scenario mentioned is about the Gartners cyst. And the remnant structure is the G artners duct. The Gartners duct is a remnant of the Wolffian ducts in women .these are located in the broad ligament and the vagina. The duct can sometimes form a cystic swelling in the broad ligament or in the vagina, it's called Gartner cyst. It is a benign condition and can be treated with marsupialisation.

Extraedge:

Proximal remnant of wolffian tubule: epoophoron Distal of wolffian tubule: paraphoron Wolffian duct remnant is gartners duct

questions.text: A 35 yr old female comes to gyneac OPD with complaints of bilateral lower abdominal pain fever, and irregular and excessive vaginal bleeding. On examination, she had adnexal tenderness. The patient was diagnosed with PID. What is the root value that caries pain fibres due to inflammation of OVARY
questions.explanation:
Solution:

T10-T11 The efferent preganglionic sympathetic fibres to the ovary are derived from the T10 - T11. The ovary is supplied by sympathetic and parasympathetic nerves. The ovarian plexuses consist of postganglionic sympathetic fibres preganglionic parasympathetic fibres from the sacral outflow and visceral afferent fibres. The ovarian plexus has the following parts: Upper part from the branches of the renal and aortic plexuses, Lower part - from the superior and inferior hypogastric plexuses

Extraedge:

The nerve supply of the uterus is t 10 - l1 The nerve supply of the ovary is t10 Nerve supply of fallopian tube t10, t11, t12.

questions.text: A 65-year-old post-menopausal female came to gynae opd with enlarging mass in her left lower abdomen and she also had masculinising symptoms. Imaging showed ovarian carcinoma. Which of the following lymph nodes should be biopsied for lymph node metastasis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Para-aortic and Superficial inguinal The ovaries are drained by Para-aortic LN (mainly ) Through corneal end to round ligament to superficial inguinal nodes (minor) The internal iliac lymph nodes surround the internal iliac artery and its branches (the hypogastric vessels. They receive lymphatics from all the pelvic viscera, from the deeper parts of the perineum, including the membranous and cavernous portions of the urethra, and the buttock and back of the thigh. It does not receive lymph from the ovary, testis, or superior half of the rectum. The gonads are drained to the paraaortic lymph nodes, while the superior half of the rectum drains to the pararectal lymph nodes.

questions.text: A 65-year-old post-menopausal woman was undergoing surgery for endometrial carcinoma. the surgery done was a total radical hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy. Which of the following statement on the surgical anatomy of the ovary is false?

options.label: A
options.text: Upper pole is related to the uterine tube.

options.label: B
options.text: The lateral surface is related to the parietal peritoneum in the ovarian fossa.

options.label: C
options.text: The posterior border is devoid of the peritoneum.

options.label: D
options.text: Lower pole is connected by the ligament of the ovary to the cornua of the uterus

questions.correct_answer: C. The posterior border is devoid of the peritoneum.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

The posterior border is devoid of the peritoneum. The upper pole of the ovary is related to the fallopian tube & suspensory ligament of the The lower pole is attached to the cornua of the uterus by the ligament of the ovary. The anterior border is devoid of peritoneum & is suspended from the broad ligament by mesovarium. The posterior border is related to the uterine tube & ureter. The medial surface is largely covered by the uterine tube. The lateral surface is related to the ovarian fossa & parietal peritoneum covering it.

questions.text: A 25-yr-old married woman came to your gyneac opd with recurrent vaginal discharge for 3 months. The discharge was foul smelling and the patient also had burning micturition. You are doing a PV examination for further management. All the following findings are the normal findings in an anatomically normal vagina during PV except

options.label: A
options.text: Posterior vaginal wall is longer than the anterior vaginal wall

options.label: B
options.text: Anterior fornix is deeper than the posterior fornix

options.label: C
options.text: The anterior lip of the cervix is lower than the posterior lip

options.label: D
options.text: The lateral fornix is related to the ureter, uterine artery and cardinal ligament.

questions.correct_answer: B. Anterior fornix is deeper than the posterior fornix
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Anterior fornix is deeper than the posterior fornix During PV, the following features of the vagina can be appreciated as the vagina is at 90 degrees anteverted to the cervix- The posterior vaginal wall is longer than the anterior vaginal wall\ There are 4 fornices- anterior, posterior, and 2 lateral The posterior fornix is deeper than the anterior fornix The anterior lip of the cervix is lower than the posterior lip The lateral fornix and cervix are related to the ureter, uterine artery and cardinal ligament. In the anteverted position, the external os is directed downward and backwards. On vaginal examination, the fingers come in contact with the anterior lip of the cervix as it is the lowest part. When the uterus is retroverted, the cervix is directed downward and forwards. The lowest part of the cervix becomes either the external os or its posterior lip.

questions.text: A 19-year-old Unmarried woman comes to the gynaecology OPD with primary Amenorrhea. On examination, the female has all other secondary sexual characteristics and breast development is normal. A USG examination revealed an absent Uterus, Fallopian tube, Cervix and upper part of the vagina. Mullerian Agenesis was suspected and the female was posted for McIndoe Vaginoplasty. All the following surgical anatomy of the vagina are correct except:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Perineal body laterally The anatomical relations of the vagina are as follows Anteriorly: Bladder ( upper 1 / 3rd ) Posteriorly

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A: Pouch of Douglas Ampulla of the rectum Laterally Mackenrodt's ligament Levator ani Option C: Bartholin's glands Option D: Urethra ( lower 2 / 3rd )

questions.text: A 23-year-old unmarried woman came to Gynecology OPD with a history of vaginal discharge and itching for the last 2 months. Since the patient was unmarried, instead of a PV examination, a gross examination of the vulva was done and the following finding was noted. Which type of a hymen is this:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Cribriform Based on the shape of its opening, the hymen may be classified as:

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- HYMEN TYPES DESCRIPTION Annular (option C) Oval central opening Crescentic (OPTION E) Semilunar central opening Vertical Vertical slit-like opening Septate Option B 2 lateral openings partitioned by a bridge of hymenal tissue Cribriform (option A) Multiple small openings Infantile Small central linear opening Imperforate (Option D) No opening Fimbriated free margin has symmetrical indentations anteriorly

questions.text: During a routine busy day in the laboratory, the technician forgets to label the above figure. The following specimen came from gynaecology OPD. From your knowledge of histology find from which of the following conditions was the sample taken for histology from gynea opd:

options.label: A
options.text: Sample from endocervix for adenocarcinoma cervix

options.label: B
options.text: Sample from ectocervix for cervical carcinoma

options.label: C
options.text: Sample from vaginal walls of a 20yr old female for infertility investigations

options.label: D
options.text: Sample from a newborn vaginal wall for rhabdomyosarcoma investigations

questions.correct_answer: C. Sample from vaginal walls of a 20yr old female for infertility investigations
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Sample from vaginal walls of a 20yr old female for infertility investigations The photomicrograph shows nonkeratinized stratified squamous epithelium, identified by flattened surface cells in the multilayered epithelium (structure 1). This type of epithelium lines moist surfaces exposed to the exterior, such as the oral cavity, tongue, pharynx, esophagus, anal canal, and The vagina is lined by non-keratinised stratified squamous epithelium (option C), but the newborn vagina is lined by transitional epithelium (option D) Cervix has 2 different types of epithelium The ecto cervix has – stratified squamous epithelium (option B) The endo cervix has – columnar epithelium (option A)

Highyeild:

The vagina is lined by non-keratinised stratified squamous epithelium Ecto cervix has –stratified squamous epithelium Endo cervix has – columnar epithelium

questions.text: A G1P0 female was in labour pain. The labour has progressed to stage 2 after full cervical dilation. The perineum was rigid due to primigravida and the head of the fetus was unable to come out. The obstetrician gave a mediolateral episiotomy cut with episiotomy scissors and delivery was successful. Before the episiotomy cut, a nerve block was given just above the tip of the ischial spine by piercing the sacrospinous ligament. What is the root value of the nerve blocked?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

S2,3,4 The nerve roots blocked in the pudendal nerve block are S2,3,4. Pudendal nerve block: The pudendal nerve (S2,3,4) is blocked just above the tip of the ischial spine by a piercing sacrospinous ligament. Used for perineal analgesia and relaxation prior to application of vacuum/forceps and for suturing vaginal lacerations as it blocks pain from the lower third of the

questions.text: With regards to the vagina, all are correct except

options.label: A
options.text: Makes an angle of 45° with the horizontal in the erect posture

options.label: B
options.text: Looks like the letter ‘H’ on the cross-section

options.label: C
options.text: Vaginal axis lies parallel to the uterus and at right angles to the plane axis of the inlet

options.label: D
options.text: Is lined by stratified squamous epithelium

questions.correct_answer: C. Vaginal axis lies parallel to the uterus and at right angles to the plane axis of the inlet
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Vaginal axis lies parallel to the uterus and at right angles to the plane axis of the inlet The canal is directed upwards and backwards forming an angle of 45° with the horizontal in erect posture. The long axis of the vagina almost lies parallel to the plane of the pelvic inlet and at right angles to that of the uterus (not vice versa). Vagina has got an anterior, a posterior, and two lateral walls. The anterior and posterior walls are apposed together but the lateral walls are comparatively stiffer especially in its middle, as such it looks ‘H’ shaped on the transverse section.

questions.text: The ovary is:

options.label: A
options.text: Is attached to the posterior layer of the broad ligament by the mesovarium

options.label: B
options.text: Has hilus cells in the cortex

options.label: C
options.text: Ovarian veins drain into the inferior vena cava

options.label: D
options.text: Is connected to the uterus by the infundibulopelvic ligament

questions.correct_answer: A. Is attached to the posterior layer of the broad ligament by the mesovarium
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Is attached to the posterior layer of the broad ligament by the mesovarium The ovary is attached to the posterior layer of the broad ligament by the mesovarium, to the lateral pelvic wall by the infundibulo pelvic ligament and to the uterus by the ovarian ligament.

questions.text: For the hormonal study, samples should be taken from which wall of the vagina:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Lateral Vaginal study gives a fair idea about the hormonal status and, in turn, about the ovulation/ovarian cycle. For the hormonal study, the sample should be taken from: Lateral wall For the cytological study (Pap smear), the sample should be taken from – the cervix

Highyeild:

For the hormonal study, the sample should be taken from: Lateral wall For the cytological study (Pap smear), the sample should be taken from the cervix, posterior fornix
